image.altText: A woman in a baby blue shirt raises her hand

props.synopsis: A frenzy of votes is beginning in the Senate, with more than 31 bills set to be rammed through tonight. Follow live.

title.children: Senate to vote on dozens of bills in crucial twilight sitting

image.altText: Albanese grins and looks up at someone while he's listening

props.synopsis: Despite what it looks like on the surface, this could be turning into a good week for the PM. Notwithstanding several key points of pain.

title.children: After a busy week in parliament, Anthony Albanese now has all he needs to trigger an election

image.altText: a huge ship with beams and pipe-laying equipment

props.synopsis: Lawyers representing Tiwi Islanders trying to stop a gas pipeline running through their traditional sea country have been ordered to pay more than $9 million to gas giant Santos for its legal costs.

title.children: Lawyers for Tiwi Island group that tried to block gas project ordered to pay $9 million to Santos

image.altText: A Qantas plane can be seen on the tarmac at Sydney Airport as a silhouetted man walks past a window inside the terminal.

props.synopsis: A Senate inquiry into the impact and mitigation of aircraft noise has highlighted the limitations of existing regulations to effectively deal with aircraft noise.

title.children: New, independent watchdog needed to help ease impact of aircraft noise on community

image.altText: Half underwater half sunset

props.synopsis: A hotter, wetter summer is on the cards for Australia, fuelled by simmering oceans, according to the long-range forecast by the Bureau of Meteorology.

title.children: A rainy December tipped by the BOM's summer outlook, but there's hope for Christmas Day

image.altText: Simon Birmingham stands in the senate chamber.

props.synopsis: Opposition Senate leader Simon Birmingham has announced he will retire from politics after 17 years to move in a "commercially orientated" direction.

title.children: Liberal senator Simon Birmingham to retire from politics at the next election

image.altText: Close-up side profile of a man

props.synopsis: Lawyers for the NT Police Force have described one of their former officers as a "racist", "misogynist" and "narcissist, with grandiose ideas about his own abilities", at the inquest into the fatal police shooting of Kumanjayi Walker.

title.children: 'Racist, misogynist, homophobic': NT police lawyer makes explosive allegations about Zachary Rolfe at inquest

image.altText: A yellow bus with smoke billowing out the top and flames on an inner city street.

props.synopsis: A bus was on a school run with 42 students when it caught fire in the centre of a New South Wales town this morning.

title.children: Dramatic vision captures school bus engulfed in flames moments after students evacuate

image.altText: A person dressed in black standing next to a pile of debris and in front of a building and banner with face of a man and woman

props.synopsis: Roads were jammed and celebratory gunfire echoed across southern Beirut as tens of thousands of displaced Lebanese returned to their homes.

title.children: Lebanon's residents celebrate returning home as Israel-Hezbollah ceasefire holds

image.altText: A court sketch of a balding man.

props.synopsis: Ashley Paul Griffith is being sentenced in the District Court in Brisbane after pleading guilty to 307 charges against 69 children at early learning centres in Brisbane and Italy.

title.children: 'You invited the devil into our home': Mother of victim describes impact of bringing daycare paedophile into her family

image.altText: A woman sits on a couch against a wall that has many photo frames.

props.synopsis: News of dangerous animal encounters tend to travel very fast in Australia, but the sometimes "racist" victim blaming that follows can compound the mental anguish of survivors.

title.children: Woman bitten by blue-ringed octopus shocked by 'racist' victim blaming on social media

image.altText: Bluey jumps in the air happily

props.synopsis: Kids and parents alike want Australian kids' TV, says new research, but local quotas have been paused.

title.children: 'It's too much for one little dog to shoulder': Australian kids' TV in 'grave danger'

image.altText: Exterior of Newcastle court.

props.synopsis: The mother of a Newcastle woman who has given evidence as four different identities during the trial defends her husband, as the prosecution alleges her "caring mother portrayal" is false.

title.children: Mother rejects daughter's multiple personality diagnosis in husband's child sex abuse trial

image.altText: A group of government officials stand in a car park

props.synopsis: Federal government officials make surprise visits to fruit and vegetable farms in Queensland’s Lockyer Valley, after receiving information from the community about alleged worker exploitation.

title.children: Alleged exploitation of migrant workers under investigation after tip-offs in 'Australia's salad bowl'

image.altText: Man with a bald head and glasses looks to the side

props.synopsis: Joe Rogan and Elon Musk have responded to comments made by the ABC's chair, Kim Williams, with the billionaire comparing the broadcaster to Russian state media.

title.children: Kim Williams says he has been exposed to 'vicious responses' after Rogan and Musk respond to his criticism

image.altText: The outside of the Nana Backpackers hostel showing a pool and outdoor seating.

props.synopsis: In the days after backpackers in Laos began falling violently ill due to suspected methanol poisoning, travellers tried desperately to warn each other about the hostel at the centre of the scandal.

title.children: 'Do not go here': Backpackers tried to warn others about Laos hostel amid methanol poisoning scandal

image.altText: Rescue workers on foot and in trucks try to clear mud and landslides in Sumatra

props.synopsis: Torrential rain in the province since last week had caused flash floods and landslides in four different districts of Sumatra.

title.children: Rescuers recover bodies from landslides on Indonesia's Sumatra island

image.altText: A group of politicians taking a selfie together.

props.synopsis: The LNP government will rush through law changes to axe Queensland's truth-telling inquiry on the first full sitting day of the new parliament.

title.children: LNP to push through law change to axe truth-telling inquiry as it introduces 'adult time, adult crime' legislation

image.altText: A girl in a black shirt with a slight smile

props.synopsis: The father of Victorian 14-year-old Krystal Cain says forensic testing has confirmed that human remains found six weeks ago near Booubyjan are his daughter's.

title.children: Teenage girl's family finally able to lay her to rest three years after she was swept away by floodwaters

image.altText: Darwin Port sign behind barbed wire.

props.synopsis: The PwC report found a "material uncertainty" about Landbridge's "ability to continue as a going concern" at the port.

title.children: Financial audit casts 'significant doubt' on Chinese-owned company's 99-year Darwin Port lease

image.altText: A supermarket shelf with little stock.

props.synopsis: Unions say the supermarket giant was warned of the consequences of a battle with its warehouse workers and that "now is the time" to improve their conditions.

title.children: Woolies customers abusing staff as warehouse workers' strike disrupts supply chain

image.altText: Carnarvon Police nab 'aggressive' lizard

props.synopsis: A police officer says he found a large crowd gathered on a West Australian street after residents had climbed onto a shed roof to escape a "very aggressive" goanna.

title.children: Body camera footage captures onlookers' screams as country cop wrangles lizard into paddy wagon

image.altText: Thorpe walks down a long corridor.

props.synopsis: Senator Lidia Thorpe responds to her suspension from the Senate, saying she does not regret tearing up a motion and throwing it at Senator Pauline Hanson.

title.children: Lidia Thorpe says she does not regret actions that caused her suspension from the Senate

image.altText: a man who is blurred in the background holds a picture up of his father

props.synopsis: Mark Swidan, Kai Li and John Leung were the final remaining Americans the National Security Council deemed wrongfully detained in China.

title.children: US says China has released three 'wrongfully detained' Americans

image.altText: Basil Zempilas and Cam Sinclair pose for a photo outside Council House wearing orange Basil hats and blue Basil Zempilas shirts.

props.synopsis: The campaign manager for Perth Lord Mayor and Liberal candidate Basil Zempilas quits his election team after apologising for his "error of judgement" when he commissioned secret polling on the Liberal leadership for a mystery businessman.

title.children: Basil Zempilas's campaign manager quits after apologising for secret polling on WA Liberal leadership

image.altText: A woman wearing yellow material wrapped around her head and upper body sits under a tent.

props.synopsis: The city of El Fasher, the capital of North Darfur in western Sudan, is at the centre of a devastating struggle between two warring factions. Humanitarian groups fear it could have catastrophic consequences.

title.children: A brutal paramilitary group is about to conquer a Sudanese city. Hundreds of thousands of people could die

image.altText: A composite image of Mo Salah, Kylian Mbappe and Cameron Carter-Vickers in the Champions League.

props.synopsis: Kylian Mbappé and Mo Salah miss penalties, Cameron Carter-Vickers scores a shocking own goal for Celtic, and Pep Guardiola apologises for an ill-advised joke. Here are five quick hits from the Champions League.

title.children: Five quick hits: Madrid and Liverpool superstars miss penalties as American scores no-look own goal in Champions League

image.altText: A photo of P Diddy at the Met Gala wearing a black and white stripped suit

props.synopsis: Sean "Diddy" Combs will remain in jail ahead of his May 5, 2025 trial on sex-trafficking charges after a US judge denied his bid on Wednesday to be released on $US50 million ($77 million) bail.

title.children: Rapper Sean 'Diddy' Combs loses $77 million bid for bail before sex-trafficking trial

image.altText: Warren sits in his kitchen.

props.synopsis: Insurance customers who want to fight massive premium increases have few options for recourse, with the financial services watchdog refusing to take on some cases.

title.children: After massive insurance premium increases, some homeowners are trying to fight back

image.altText: A sketch of a convicted murderer and rapist in court

props.synopsis: James Beauregard-Smith was jailed for murdering his former partner Sandra Holland and her two sons Craig, 9, and Scott, 11, in July 1977. Just a week after he was granted parole, he raped a 21-year-old woman and has remained in custody ever since.

title.children: Triple murderer and rapist dubbed 'one of the worst criminals' in SA dies in custody

image.altText: An internal view of the Metro Tunnel.

props.synopsis: New documents from the Victorian government reveal the planned handover date for the Metro Tunnel under Melbourne's CBD has been delayed from April to December next year.

title.children: Long-awaited Melbourne Metro Tunnel's 2025 launch delayed again

image.altText: Phoebe Thorburn stands behind a wooden kitchen bench with their hands on the benchtop, looking happy.

props.synopsis: Phoebe was offered a role that was perfect on paper, but the reality of what it entailed made them rethink what a "dream job" looks like.

title.children: 'I cried all the way home': Why Phoebe said no to their dream job

image.altText: Woman with short dark hair and black lace top looking at camera.

props.synopsis: A Perth mother says her daughter was turned away from Hollywood Private Hospital's emergency department because she has a disability, but the hospital says the family left before it could complete a medical assessment.

title.children: Mother says private hospital's emergency department refused to treat daughter with disability

image.altText: A close up of a man's hand holding an obscured credit card while the other hand types on a laptop.

props.synopsis: With so many retailers spruiking big bargains this month, we're easy targets for fraudsters looking to cash in on the frenzied spending.

title.children: Black Friday sales are ramping up this week. So are scams
